segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s standing in a puddle, but her face is so calm, like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on the wobbly stool, reaching for cookies like he’s on a mission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip, and I can’t believe the woman hasn’t noticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, not even caring about the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the sink is going to flood the whole kitchen if someone doesn’t turn it off soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will slip on the wet floor before she even realizes what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on those cookies, he doesn’t even notice how dangerous his position is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious everyone is to the water spilling everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and the kids don’t seem to care about anything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this kitchen is one small step away from total disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
